intro: Sphaeranthus strobilaceus, commonly known as the Christmas star or starflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring erect, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces showy, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. Sphaeranthus strobilaceus is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
